title: Test the install script fix
description:
## Objective
Create and execute test scenarios to verify that the install script correctly backs up and removes original APM command files during migration.

## Requirements
- Set up test environment simulating original APM installation
- Create mock original APM command files (can be empty or minimal content)
- Run install script migration case
- Verify backup directory created with exactly 6 files
- Verify exactly 6 files removed from .claude/commands/
- Verify new Beads-APM commands installed (exactly 2 files)
- Clean up test environment after verification

## Done When
- Test environment successfully created with git and .apm directory (can be empty)
- Mock APM files created (6 files: apm-1-initiate-setup.md through apm-6-handover-implementation.md)
- Install script executed without errors
- Backup verification passed: .claude/commands.apm.backup.TIMESTAMP exists with exactly 6 files
- Removal verification passed: 6 original APM files absent from .claude/commands/
- Installation verification passed: 2 new files present (apm-setup.md, apm-start.md)
- Test environment cleaned up
- Test results demonstrate fix works correctly

## Guidance
Create a temporary test directory and initialize it as a git repository with an existing .apm directory (can be empty - install script only checks for directory existence). Create mock versions of the 6 original APM command files in .claude/commands/ within the test directory (empty files or minimal content is sufficient for testing). Run the install script targeting the test directory to trigger the migrate_original_apm case (note: Beads installation will be attempted but can be skipped for this test - focus is on command file handling). Verify that .claude/commands.apm.backup.TIMESTAMP directory was created and contains exactly 6 original APM command files. Verify that exactly 6 files were removed from .claude/commands/ and exactly 2 new Beads-APM commands (apm-setup.md, apm-start.md) are present. Clean up the temporary test directory after verification completes.

comments.author: hbchuc
comments.text: Test completed successfully. Created test environment with git repo, .apm directory, and 6 mock original APM command files. Executed install script which correctly triggered migrate_original_apm case. Verified: (1) Backup directory created with exactly 6 files, (2) 6 original files removed from .claude/commands/, (3) 2 new Beads-APM commands installed (apm-setup.md, apm-start.md), (4) Original content preserved in backup, (5) APM guides replaced with Beads-APM versions, (6) metadata.json contains variant marker. All test requirements passed. Test environment cleaned up.

title: Create Agent Discovery Guide
description:
## Objective
Create new shared Agent_Discovery_Guide.md for discovering available Claude Code agents.

## Requirements
- Discovery mechanism with explicit commands:
  - Built-ins: general-purpose, explore, plan (always available)
  - Custom agents: `find .claude/agents -name "*.md" -type f`
  - Parse YAML frontmatter (name, description, tools, model fields)
- Built-in agent descriptions:
  - general-purpose: Full capabilities, complex multi-step tasks (Sonnet)
  - explore: Fast read-only codebase search (Haiku)
  - plan: Read-only planning/research (Sonnet)
- Guidance on when to use which agent type (task characteristics → agent matching)
- Label convention: agent:<name> prefix (e.g., agent:explore, agent:general-purpose)
- Document dual-use: Setup Agent uses for labeling, Manager Agent uses for validation

## Done When
- Agent_Discovery_Guide.md exists at .apm/guides/Agent_Discovery_Guide.md
- Contains discovery mechanism with explicit commands
- Contains built-in descriptions with capabilities and model info
- Contains usage guidance and label convention
- Documents that both Setup and Manager reference this guide

## Guidance
This is the foundation that Project_Breakdown_Guide and Agent_Workflow_Guide will reference.
Keep concise but include explicit discovery commands so Implementation Agent knows exactly how to scan for custom agents.

comments.author: hbchuc
comments.text: Created Agent_Discovery_Guide.md at .apm/guides/ with discovery mechanism, built-in agent descriptions, usage guidance, label convention, and dual-use documentation

title: Modify install script to backup and remove original APM commands
description:
## Objective
Modify the migrate_original_apm case in install.sh to backup and remove the 6 original APM command files before installing new Beads-APM commands.

## Requirements
- Backup original APM command files to .claude/commands.apm.backup.TIMESTAMP directory
- Remove 6 specific APM command files from .claude/commands/:
  - .claude/commands/apm-1-initiate-setup.md
  - .claude/commands/apm-2-initiate-manager.md
  - .claude/commands/apm-3-initiate-implementation.md
  - .claude/commands/apm-4-initiate-adhoc.md
  - .claude/commands/apm-5-handover-manager.md
  - .claude/commands/apm-6-handover-implementation.md
- Follow existing backup pattern used for .apm directory
- Skip files that don't exist without errors (use conditional checks)
- Execute before install_claude_commands call

## Done When
- Backup directory created with timestamp format (YYYYMMDDHHMMSS)
- All 6 original APM command files backed up (if they exist)
- Files removed from .claude/commands/
- Code follows existing install.sh patterns and style
- Changes integrated into migrate_original_apm case

## Guidance
Review the existing .apm backup pattern (lines 388-392) to understand the backup directory naming and copy approach. Create .claude/commands.apm.backup.TIMESTAMP directory using the same timestamp format as the .apm backup (date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S). Copy the 6 original APM command files to the backup directory - use conditional checks (if [ -f "file" ]) to skip files that don't exist, following the error handling pattern used elsewhere in install.sh. Remove the 6 files from .claude/commands/ directory only after successful backup. Add this backup and removal logic in the migrate_original_apm case BEFORE the install_claude_commands call (around line 405).

comments.text:
Modified install.sh to backup and remove 6 original APM command files in migrate_original_apm case. Created backup logic that:
- Uses timestamp format YYYYMMDDHHMMSS (matching .apm backup pattern)
- Creates .claude/commands.apm.backup.TIMESTAMP directory
- Backs up 6 original APM command files (apm-1-initiate-setup.md through apm-6-handover-implementation.md)
- Uses conditional checks (if [ -f ]) to skip non-existent files
- Removes files only after successful backup
- Executes before install_claude_commands call
- Updates migration completion message to include commands backup location
